main event: On July 6, 1957, multiple witnesses observed an unidentified flying object in the sky over Shiloh, Ohio.
interesting points: The object was described as a dull reddish-orange round shape, about 25-30 feet in diameter, observed for approximately 3 minutes., Another witness reported a bright, elongated object that moved rapidly across the horizon at an estimated speed of 600 mph., The object was sometimes reported to be circular and silvery, indicating variation in descriptions., Investigators concluded that the sightings do not match any known aircraft, satellite, or natural celestial phenomenon., Despite thorough investigations, these cases remain classified as unidentified under Project Blue Book.
witness description: Various adults and a couple, including Mr. and Mrs. Richard T. Plummer and Mr. F. A. Hartman.
